findings.description: CI workflow creates a dummy google-services.json inline. If the JSON format changes or Firebase plugin requires additional fields, the build will break silently. Consider storing a CI-specific google-services.json as a repository secret or encrypted file.
findings.recommendation: Acceptable for now. Document as known limitation. When Firebase is properly configured, replace with repository secret.

findings.description: org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx4096m is set as specified in task requirements. This is appropriate for bitcoinj/web3j compilation. Consider adding -XX:+UseParallelGC for faster CI builds.
Using Gradle 8.5 which is compatible with AGP 8.2.2. Distribution URL uses bin variant (not all). Consider using gradle-8.5-all.zip for IDE source navigation, but bin is correct for CI.
findings.recommendation: No action needed. bin variant is appropriate.

findings.description: BouncyCastle dependency substitution in subprojects block is a clean solution for the jdk15to18/jdk18on conflict between bitcoinj and web3j. Well documented with because() clause.
CI uses actions/cache@v4 for Gradle caches with hash-based key. Workflow triggers on push/PR for android/** paths only, which is correct for monorepo setup. Upload artifact step properly scoped.
findings.recommendation: No action needed. CI configuration is appropriate.

summary: Infrastructure setup is solid. Gradle wrapper, properties, and CI workflow are well-configured. Module structure follows standard Android multi-module patterns. BouncyCastle resolution is clean. One medium finding about inline google-services.json in CI, acceptable for MVP.
